generif.text: Data indicate that myomiR-206 modulates Hmgb3 expression during myogenesis.
HMGB3 has a role in gastric cancer disease onset and progression by regulating the cell cycle
HMGB3 plays an important role in non-small cell lung cancer progression.
regulation of HMGB3 by miR-205 reduced both proliferation and invasion of breast cancer cells.
Association between co-expression networks involving HMGB3 and differentially-expressed genes in gastric cancer.
In this family, microphthalmia, microcephaly, intellectual disability, and short stature are associated with a mutation on the X chromosome in the HMGB3 gene.
High expression of HMGB3 is associated with lymph node metastases in gastric cancer.
our data suggests HMGB3 may serve as an important oncoprotein and indicate that overexpression of HMGB3 in urinary bladder cancer could be used as a potential prognostic marker.
these findings demonstrate that HMBG3 may be a potential molecular marker for predicting the prognosis of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma patients
Therefore, we infer that HMGB3 is a functional target of miR-27b in modulation of tamoxifen resistance and EMT.
HMGB3 regulates the genes expression of WNT/beta-catenin pathway
Luciferase reporter assays showed that HMGB3 was directly regulated by miR-205-5p in prostate cancer cells.
HMGB3 is involved in malignant transformation of hepatocytes and could be a useful biomarker for diagnosis and a potential target for therapy of liver cancer.
The study strongly suggests that HMGB3 promotes GBM oncogenesis through the MAPK signalling pathway while miR-200b-3p and miR-200c-3p inhibit its expression.

HMGB3 overexpression or miR-200b downregulation was associated with poor prognosis. Our findings suggest HMGB3 may serve as an important oncoprotein whose expression is negatively regulated by miR-200b in hepatocellular carcinoma.
HMGB3 has higher expression in non-small cell lung cancer tissues.HMGB3 is the target gene of miR-758.

HMGB3 might be of very great significance to the pathogenesis of FGR and might play the role by leading the dysfunction of placental villous trophoblast cells and through the interaction with some other proteins
High HMGB3 expression is associated with Chemo-resistance in Ovarian Cancer.

HOTTIP was upregulated and miR-615-3p was downregulated in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) tissues and cells. Hypoxia induced glycolysis, increased HOTTIP and HMGB3 mRNA levels and repressed miR-615-3p expression in NSCLC cells. HOTTIP deficiency or miR-615-3p expression restoration repressed hypoxia-induced glycolysis. HOTTIP acted as a molecular sponge for miR-615-3p and HMGB3 was a direct target of miR-615-3p.
Bioinformatics analysis of the prognosis and biological significance of HMGB1, HMGB2, and HMGB3 in gastric cancer.
HMGB3 small interfere RNA suppresses mammosphere formation of MDA-MB-231 cells by down-regulating expression of HIF1alpha.
Circ-0001801 contributes to cell proliferation, migration, invasion and epithelial to mesenchymal transition (EMT) in glioblastoma by regulating miR-628-5p/HMGB3 axis.
LncRNA SNHG5 promotes nasopharyngeal carcinoma progression by regulating miR-1179/HMGB3 axis.
High-mobility group box 3 (HMGB3) silencing inhibits non-small cell lung cancer development through regulating Wnt/beta-catenin pathway.
Long Noncoding RNA SOX2-OT Knockdown Inhibits Proliferation and Metastasis of Prostate Cancer Cells Through Modulating the miR-452-5p/HMGB3 Axis and Inactivating Wnt/beta-Catenin Pathway.
LncRNA PITPNA-AS1 boosts the proliferation and migration of lung squamous cell carcinoma cells by recruiting TAF15 to stabilize HMGB3 mRNA.
CircRNA_102179 promotes the proliferation, migration and invasion in non-small cell lung cancer cells by regulating miR-330-5p/HMGB3 axis.
High mobility group box 3 promotes cervical cancer proliferation by regulating Wnt/beta-catenin pathway.
The role of high mobility group protein B3 (HMGB3) in tumor proliferation and drug resistance.
MiR-93/HMGB3 regulatory axis exerts tumor suppressive effects in colorectal carcinoma cells.
LINC00319 promotes cancer stem cell-like properties in laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma via E2F1-mediated upregulation of HMGB3.
LINC00857 promotes colorectal cancer progression by sponging miR-150-5p and upregulating HMGB3 (high mobility group box 3) expression.
miR-142-3p simultaneously targets HMGA1, HMGA2, HMGB1, and HMGB3 and inhibits tumorigenic properties and in-vivo metastatic potential of human cervical cancer cells.
HMGB3 promotes PARP inhibitor resistance through interacting with PARP1 in ovarian cancer.
Long Noncoding RNA Brain Cytoplasmic RNA 1 Induces Cisplatin-Resistance of Cervical Cancer Cells by Sponging MicroRNA-330-5p and Upregulating High-Mobility Group Box 3.
SOX9 and HMGB3 co-operatively transactivate NANOG and promote prostate cancer progression.
Circ-IGF1R Affects the Progression of Colorectal Cancer by Activating the miR-362-5p/HMGB3-Mediated Wnt/beta-Catenin Signal Pathway.
HMGB3 promotes the malignant phenotypes and stemness of epithelial ovarian cancer through the MAPK/ERK signaling pathway.
Exosomal HMGB3 released by glioma cells confers the activation of NLRP3 inflammasome and pyroptosis in tumor-associated macrophages.

BP.term: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

interpro.desc: HMG box A DNA-binding domain, conserved site
High mobility group box domain superfamily

name: high mobility group box 3
summary: This gene encodes a member of a family of proteins containing one or more high mobility group DNA-binding motifs. The encoded protein plays an important role in maintaining stem cell populations, and may be aberrantly expressed in tumor cells. A mutation in this gene was associated with microphthalmia, syndromic 13. There are numerous pseudogenes of this gene on multiple chromosomes. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2014].
